result.execSummary:
The defendant James L Tourtillott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14(2).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence that the defendant is or may be serving (16CF27 - Langlade County Case)
Concurrent with: Case #16CF101 but consecutive to any sentence the defendant is or will be serving.

miscConds.notes: To be collected through the Clerk of Court's office. Payment due 60 days after release of incarceration.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
Must undergo psychological assessment and an anger management assessment follow through with any and all recommendations.
No consumption or possession of alcohol. Not to enter any bars or taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Undecided
State's Settlement Recommendation

Defendant James L Tourtillott in court with attorney Paul Arbuckle.  Defendant James L Tourtillott in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:47 PM. Called 16CF101, 16CM76 and 16CM53. State - resolved - have complied with victim notification requirements on all three cases with no responses, VIS or request for restitution - on 16CF101 - DRI counts #1 and #2, plead as alleged to counts #3 and #4 - 9 months in FC jail  - consecutive to each other and to any sentence that the defendant may be currently serving - imposed and stayed - place on probation for 2 years with conditions to be stated later; on 16CM53 - DRI counts #1, #2 and #4, plead alleged to counts #3 and #5 - on both counts #3 and #5 - 9  months in FC jail - consecutive to each other and to jail time on 16CF101 and to any sentence that the defendant is currently serving  - stayed - place on probation for 2 years - concurrent to 16CF101; on 16CM76 - plead to both counts as alleged, on both counts #1 and #2 - 9 months in FC jail - consecutive to each other and to 16CM53 and 16CF101 and to any other sentence that the defendant may be serving - stayed, place on probation for 2 years - concurrent to each other and to probation on 16CF101 and 16CM53; conditons of probation on each count include: costs on each count - 60 DTP/CO, AODA and follow thru, anger management and/or psychological assessment and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 100 hours of community service (total for all three cases). Arbuckle and Tourtillott agree. Court makes sure the defendant knows what it means for a count to be DRI. Court - 16CF101 - DRI counts #1 and #2; on16CM53 - DRI counts #1, #2 and #4. Tourtillott pleads NC to all other counts as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts pleas, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Arbuckle makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Tourtillott withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 16CF101 - counts #3 and #4, on 16CM53 - counts #3 and #5, on 16CM76 - counts #1 and #2 - on all counts of all three cases - impose 9 months in FC jail - consecutive to any sentence that the defendant may be serving (16CF27 - Langlade County Case) and to each other within each case and to each case - stayed - place on probation for 2 years on each count - all concurrent to each other but consecutive to the ES that he will be on from the sentence that he is currently serving- with conditions of: costs on each count - 60 DTP after release from incarceration/CO, AODA and follow thru, anger management and psychological assessment and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 100 hours of community service (total for all three cases), counsel has 30 days to submit either a request or stipulation for credit, submit DNA sample, right to appeal, adjourned.
DA cover letter
request for prompt disposition

Final pre-trial on May 9, 2018 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant James L Tourtillott in court with attorney Paul Arbuckle.  Defendant James L Tourtillott in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:52 PM. Called 16CF101, 16CM53 and 16CM76. State - has filed an Amended Complaint today in 16CF101 and the Information that was filed in this matter mirror the Amended Complaint - believes there is a waiver of PH on the CF case due to an offer by the State to proceed with no felony conviction. Arbuckle and Tourtillott agree and waives further reading of the Amended Complaint. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probably cause, binds over for trial. Arbuckle has Information that mirrors the Amended Complaint, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN, pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts NG pleas, continues bond on all matters, sets all matter for FPT.
Incarcerated FOSO

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Paul Arbuckle in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:03 PM. Called 16CF101, 16CM53 and 16CM76. Arbuckle indicates he is unaware of where defendant is. Court forfeits bond in all cases. Issues warrants of $500 on 16CM53 and 16CM76 and $1000 warrant on the 16CF101. Arbuckle indicates his client is on probation and asks if warrant could be quashed if he reach his client and appear voluntarily tomorrow. Court indicates Tourtillott can make a voluntairly appearance but may have to sit and wait or if he's picked up then a hearing could be scheduled.
Status conference on July 27, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
No consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bar or tavern, no contact wi th DW.
to sig bond

Defendant James L Tourtillott in court with attorney .  Defendant James L Tourtillott in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:16 PM. Called 16CF101, 16CM53 and 16CM76. Arbuckle has complaints, pleads NG to all counts on 16CM53 and 16CM76. Court accepts NG pleas to those two cases. Arbuckle wants a PH for 16CF101, Arbuckle states that the defendant has informed him that his client has not received any of the previous notices for court and states that he was not aware of the charges, asks for signature bond on all matters. State - bond - objects to signature bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - $1000.00 signature bond on each case, no consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, no contact with any victims (D.W. on 16CM53 and 16CM76 and on 16CF101 - K.J. and L.J.). Arbuckle waives time limits for PH. Court considers time limits waived, sets CF for PH and other matters for STC.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
No consumption of alcohol, no contact with victim (DW).

Defendant James L Tourtillott in court, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:06 PM. Called 16CF101, 16CM76 and 16CM53. State - believe we are here on return on warrants on all matters. Tourtillot states he has not received any complaints, gives new address of 1002 Cherry Street, Green Bay, WI  54302. Court reads charges and penalties on all matters. Tourtillott understands all charges and penalties, wants an attorney, cannot afford his own, states he has SPD in another matter in another county. Court refers the defendant to SPD, instructed to contact them today, court also gives court appointed attorney information. State - bond - amend bond on 16CF101 to $500.00 cash bond. Court - bond - 16CF101 - $500.00 cash, no consumption of alcohol, no contact with the victim (LJ); 16CM53 - $300.00 cash bond, no consumption of alcohol, no contact with victim (DW); 16CM76 - $200.00 cash bond, no consumption of alcohol, no contact with victim (DW). Court sets all matters for AIA. Tourtillott asks for signature bond on all matters for stated reasons. Court will take bond up at next hearing, again reminded to contact SPD.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
